skill.name: Mobile Debugging
skill.description: Debug React Native apps including metro bundler issues, native errors, performance problems, and crash analysis. Use when troubleshooting errors or investigating issues.
skill.summary: Debug React Native apps including metro bundler issues, native errors, performance problems, and cra...
skill.author: BabakBar

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/markdown skill containing debugging guidance for React Native apps. No executable code, scripts, or network operations. The bash commands shown are standard developer commands publicly documented in React Native/Expo resources.

content.user_title: Debug React Native and Expo mobile apps
content.value_statement: React Native apps can crash, freeze, or fail to build without clear error messages. This skill provides step-by-step debugging commands and techniques to diagnose and fix metro bundler errors, native module issues, performance problems, and build failures.
actual_capabilities: Diagnose and fix Metro bundler issues with cache clearing commands
Resolve native module errors for iOS and Android platforms
Debug network request failures in React Native apps
Identify and fix performance problems and memory leaks
Investigate build failures and dependency conflicts
limitations: Cannot directly access or modify your app's source code
Cannot run commands on physical devices remotely
Requires developer to execute commands in their local environment
Does not replace platform-specific debuggers like Xcode or Android Studio

use_cases.title: Fix app crashes
use_cases.description: Diagnose why your React Native app crashes on startup or during navigation using log analysis and common fixes

use_cases.title: Resolve build errors
use_cases.description: Troubleshoot iOS and Android build failures caused by native module incompatibilities or corrupted caches

use_cases.title: Debug performance issues
use_cases.description: Identify slow renders, memory leaks, and network problems affecting app performance and user experience

prompt_templates.title: Metro bundler won't start
prompt_templates.prompt: My React Native Metro bundler is not starting. I see 'Unable to connect' errors. Help me diagnose and fix this.

prompt_templates.title: iOS build failure
prompt_templates.prompt: My iOS build is failing with a native module error. How do I troubleshoot and resolve this?

prompt_templates.title: App performance slow
prompt_templates.prompt: My React Native app is running slowly. How do I identify which components are causing slow renders and fix memory leaks?

prompt_templates.title: Android emulator issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My Android emulator is not responding or showing device offline. How do I reset and reconnect it properly?

output_examples.input: My Metro bundler shows 'Unable to resolve module' error for a package I installed
output: 1. Clear Metro cache: npx expo start --clear
4. Reinstall dependencies: rm -rf node_modules && npm install
6. If still failing, check your import path is correct and the package exports the module you are importing

best_practices: Always clear caches first when troubleshooting bundler issues after dependency changes
Check platform-specific logs (Xcode console for iOS, logcat for Android) when native errors occur
Reproduce the issue consistently before making changes to understand the root cause
anti_patterns: Skipping the error stack trace and guessing at the problem
Only testing on one platform when the issue might be platform-specific
Making multiple changes at once without isolating the fix

faq.question: Does this skill work with Expo Router and Expo Go?
faq.answer: Yes. The debugging commands work with Expo Router projects and Expo Go. Some native fixes require running expo prebuild or building a development build.

faq.question: How far back does this skill support debugging for?
faq.answer: Commands work with Expo SDK 50+ and React Native 0.73+. Older versions may have slightly different commands for some operations.

faq.question: Can I use these debugging techniques with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Most commands work in CI environments. Some simulator commands (xcrun) only work on macOS with Xcode installed.

faq.question: Does this skill store or transmit any data?
faq.answer: No. This is a documentation-only skill. It provides guidance without accessing your files, credentials, or sending data anywhere.

faq.question: Why do I keep needing to clear caches?
faq.answer: Caches can become stale when dependencies change, files are moved, or watchman state gets corrupted. Regular cache clearing is normal in React Native development.

faq.question: How is this different from using Flipper or React DevTools?
faq.answer: This skill provides CLI-based debugging for issues that tools like Flipper cannot fix. Use Flipper for UI inspection and network debugging alongside these commands.
